content:
San Francisco is a hub for literary events. Here are some book reading events in San Francisco for the next month (please note that dates and events are subject to change, and it's always a good idea to double-check with the venue or organizer before attending):

**Week of March 6-12**

1. **The Rakestraw Books Author Series**: Rakestraw Books in San Francisco's Cole Valley neighborhood hosts author readings and conversations. On March 10, they'll feature author Julia Fierro discussing her novel "The Gypsy Moth Summer". (7:00 pm, free)
2. **San Francisco Public Library**: The SFPL Main Branch hosts a **Literary Reading Series**. On March 11, author and poet, Danez Smith, will read from their work. (6:00 pm, free)

**Week of March 13-19**

1. **City Lights Books**: This iconic independent bookstore in North Beach hosts many author readings. On March 15, author and journalist, Mark Danner, will discuss his latest book, "Spiral: Trapped in the Forever War". (7:00 pm, free)
2. **The Booksmith**: This Haight-Ashbury bookstore hosts a **Book Club** discussion on March 16, featuring "The Song of Achilles" by Madeline Miller. (7:00 pm, free)
3. **SF State University**: The **Poetry Center** at SF State University presents a reading by poet, Angela Marino, on March 17. (4:30 pm, free)

**Week of March 20-26**

1. **Green Apple Books**: This Richmond District bookstore hosts a **Literary Fiction Book Club** discussion on March 22, featuring "The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao" by Junot Díaz. (7:00 pm, free)
2. **The Bindery**: This Mission District bookstore hosts a **Book Club** discussion on March 24, featuring "The Power" by Naomi Alderman. (7:00 pm, free)

**Week of March 27-31**

1. **Book Passage**: This Corte Madera-based bookstore (just outside SF) hosts a **Literary Salon** on March 29, featuring author and journalist, Kelly Corrigan. (7:00 pm, free)

These are just a few events to get you started. You can also check the websites of these bookstores and libraries, as well as others in San Francisco, for more events and author readings throughout the month. Enjoy!
